talent.name: Adventurer
description: {@skill Athletics||crb} and {@skill Knowledge (Adventuring)} are now career skills for your character.

talent.name: Adversary
description: {@i Player characters cannot benefit from this talent}. Upgrade the difficulty of all combat checks targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

talent.name: Animal Companion
description: Your character creates a bond with a single animal approved by your GM. This animal must be silhouette 0 (no larger than a mid-sized dog). The bond persists as long as your character chooses, although at your GM's discretion, the bond may also be broken due to abusive treatment or other extenuating circumstances.

As long as the bond persists, the animal follows your character, and you dictate the animal's overall behavior (although, since the animal is only bonded with the character, not dominated, it may still perform inconvenient actions such as scratching furniture, consuming rations, and marking territory). Once per round in structured encounters, your character may spend one maneuver to direct their animal in performing one action and one maneuver during your character's turn. The animal must be within hearing and visual range of your character (generally medium range) to do this. Otherwise, the animal does not contribute to the encounter. The specifics of its behavior are up to you and your GM.

For every additional rank of Animal Companion your character has, increase the allowed silhouette of the companion by one (this may mean your character gets a new companion, or their companion grows in size).

This talent can also change in flavor depending on the nature of your game setting. While an animal companion may make sense in many settings, in a futuristic setting it may make more sense for the "animal" to be a robot or drone, for example.

talent.name: Apothecary
description: When a patient under your character's care heals wounds from natural rest, they heal additional wounds equal to twice your character's ranks in Apothecary.

talent.name: Back-to-Back
description: While engaged with one or more allies, your character and allies they are engaged with add {@dice boost} to combat checks. If one or more allies engaged with your character also have Back-to-Back, the effects are cumulative to a maximum of {@dice boost|2}.

talent.name: Backstab
description: Your character may use this talent to attack an unaware adversary using a Melee (Light) weapon. A Backstab is a melee attack, and follows the normal rules for performing a combat check (see page 101 of the {@title Genesys Core Rulebook}), using the character's {@skill Skulduggery||crb} skill instead of {@skill Melee (Light)||crb}. If the check succeeds, each uncanceled {@symbols s} adds +2 damage (instead of the normal +1).

talent.name: Bard
description: {@skill Knowledge (Lore)} and {@skill Verse} are now career skills for your character.

talent.name: Barrel Roll
description: Your character can only use this talent while piloting a starfighter or airplane of Silhouette 3 or less. When your vehicle suffers a hit from a ranged combat check, after damage is calculated but before armor is applied, your character may have their vehicle suffer 3 system strain to use this talent. Then, reduce the damage suffered by a number equal to their ranks in Piloting.

talent.name: Basic Military Training
description: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Ranged (Heavy)}, and {@skill Resilience} are now career skills for your character.

talent.name: Battle Casting
description: Your character does not add {@dice setback} to magic skill checks for wearing heavy armor (armor with +2 soak or higher), using a shield, or not having at least one hand free (see {@table III.2-3: Penalties When Casting Spells||crb}, on page 210 of the {@title Genesys Core Rulebook}).

talent.name: Berserk
description: Once per encounter, your character may use this talent. Until the end of the encounter or until they are incapacitated, your character adds {@symbols saa} to all melee combat checks they make. However, opponents add {@symbols s} to all combat checks targeting your character. While berserk, your character cannot make ranged combat checks. At the end of the encounter (or when they are incapacitated), your character suffers 6 strain.

talent.name: Block
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the {@talent Parry||crb} talent to benefit from this talent}. While wielding a shield, your character may use the {@talent Parry||crb} talent to reduce damage from ranged attacks as well as melee attacks targeting your character.

talent.name: Blood Sacrifice
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the {@talent Dark Insight} talent to benefit from this talent}. Before your character makes a magic skill check, they may suffer a number of wounds to use this talent to add an equal number of {@symbols s} to the check. The number cannot exceed your character's ranks in Blood Sacrifice.

talent.name: Body Guard
description: Once per round, your character may suffer a number of strain no greater than their ranks in Body Guard to use this talent. Choose one ally engaged with your character; until the end of your character's next turn, upgrade the difficulty of all combat checks targeting that ally a number of times equal to the strain suffered.

talent.name: Bought Info
description: When making any knowledge skill check, your character can instead use this talent to spend an amount of currency equal to fifty times the difficulty of the check and automatically succeed on the knowledge check with one uncanceled {@symbols s} (instead of rolling). At your GM's discretion, your character may not be able to use Bought Info if the information is particularly sensitive or difficult to find, or buying it doesn't make narrative sense.

talent.name: Brilliant Casting
description: When your character casts a spell, you may spend one Story Point to use this talent to add {@symbols a} equal to your character's ranks in {@skill Knowledge||crb} to the results.

talent.name: Bullrush
description: When your character makes a {@skill Brawl||crb}, {@skill Melee (Light)||crb}, or {@skill Melee (Heavy)||crb} combat check after using a maneuver to engage a target, you may spend {@symbols aaa} or {@symbols t} to use this talent to knock the target prone and move them up to one range band away from your character.

talent.name: Bulwark
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the {@skill Parry||crb} talent to benefit from this talent}. While wielding a weapon with the {@quality Defensive||crb} quality, your character may use {@skill Parry||crb} to reduce the damage of an attack targeting an engaged ally.

talent.name: Can't We Talk About This?
description: Your character can use this talent to make an opposed {@skill Charm} or {@skill Deception} versus {@skill Discipline} check targeting a single non-nemesis adversary within medium range. If the check succeeds, the target cannot attack your character (or perform hostile actions against your character) until the end of their next turn. You may spend {@symbols aa} to increase the length of the effect by one additional turn, and spend {@symbols t} to extend the benefits to all of their identified allies within short range. The effect ends immediately if your character or a known ally attacks the target. In addition, your GM may rule that some targets are immune to this ability. An automated sentry turret, for example, has no interest in resolving a conflict through talking, nor would someone consumed by rage and the desire for revenge against your character.

talent.name: Cavalier
description: While riding a mount trained for battle (typically a {@adversary War Mount} [see page 105] or {@adversary Flying Mount} [see page 104]), once per round your character may use this talent to direct the mount to perform an action.

talent.name: Challenge!
description: Once per encounter, your character may use this talent to choose a number of adversaries within short range no greater than your character's ranks in Challenge! (a minion group counts as a single adversary for this purpose). Until the encounter ends or your character is incapacitated, these adversaries add {@dice boost} to combat checks targeting your character and {@dice setback|2} to combat checks targeting other characters.

talent.name: Chill of Nordros
description: Your character cannot take this talent if they have taken the {@talent Flames of Kellos} talent. When casting an {@spell Attack||crb} spell, your character may add the Ice effect without increasing the difficulty. Your character can never add the Fire effect.

talent.name: Clever Retort
description: Once per encounter, your character may use this talent to add automatic {@symbols hh} to another character's social skill check.

talent.name: Component Casting
description: When your character casts a spell, they may use this talent to consume a physical item and add {@dice boost} to the check. The item does not have to be expensive or rare, but it does have to be thematically appropriate for the spell, available to your character, and subject to your GM's approval. Some examples include a match or bit of sulphur for an {@spell Attack||crb} spell with the {@quality Burn||crb} quality, a piece of glass for a {@spell Predict} spell, or a scrap of bandage for a {@spell Heal||crb} spell.

talent.name: Conduit
description: Once per encounter, your character may spend a Story Point to perform a magic action as a maneuver.

talent.name: Coordinated Assault
description: Once per turn, your character may use this talent to have a number of allies engaged with your character equal to your ranks in {@skill Leadership} add {@symbols a} to all combat checks they make until the end of your character's next turn. The range of this talent increases by one band per rank of Coordinated Assault beyond the first.

talent.name: Counterattack
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the {@talent Parry (Improved)|Improved Parry|crb} talent to benefit from this talent}. When your character uses the {@talent Parry (Improved)|Improved Parry|crb} talent to hit an attacker, they may also activate an item quality of the weapon they used as if they had generated {@symbols aa} on a combat check using that weapon.

talent.name: Counteroffer
description: Once per session, your character may use this talent to choose one non-nemesis adversary within medium range and make an opposed {@skill Negotiation} versus {@skill Discipline} check. If successful, the target becomes {@rule staggered} until the end of their next turn. At your GM's discretion, you may spend {@symbols t} on this check to have the adversary become an ally until the end of the encounter. However, the duration of this may be shortened or extended depending on whether your GM feels your offer is appealing to the adversary and whether your character follows through on their offer!

talent.name: Crushing Blow
description: Once per session after rolling a melee attack but before resolving the check, your character may suffer 4 strain to use this talent. While resolving the check, the weapon gains the {@quality Breach|Breach 1|crb} and {@quality Knockdown||crb} item qualities, and destroys one item the target is wielding that does not have the {@quality Reinforced||crb} quality.

talent.name: Daring Aviator
description: Before your character makes a {@skill Driving} or {@skill Piloting} check, they may add a number of {@symbols h} to the results to use this talent to add an equal number of {@symbols s}. The number may not exceed your character's ranks in Daring Aviator.

talent.name: Dark Insight
description: When a spell adds a quality to your character's spell with a rating determined by your character's ranks in {@skill Knowledge (Lore)}, your character may use their ranks in {@skill Knowledge (Forbidden)} instead.

talent.name: Deadeye
description: After your character inflicts a {@table I.6-10: Critical Injury Result|Critical Injury} with a ranged weapon and rolls the result, your character may suffer 2 strain to use this talent. Then, you may select any {@table I.6-10: Critical Injury Result|Critical Injury} of the same severity to apply to the target instead.

talent.name: Death Rage
description: Your character adds +2 damage to melee attacks for each {@table I.6-10: Critical Injury Result|Critical Injury|crb} they are currently suffering. (Your GM may also impose additional penalties on social skill checks your character makes if they are suffering {@table I.6-10: Critical Injury Result|Critical Injury|crb} due to their frenzied behavior.)

talent.name: Dedication
description: Each rank of Dedication increases one of your character's characteristics by one. This talent cannot increase a characteristic above 5. You cannot increase the same characteristic with Dedication twice.

talent.name: Defensive
description: Each rank of Defensive increases your character's melee defense and ranged defense by one.

talent.name: Defensive Driving
description: Increase the defense of any vehicle your character pilots by one per rank of Defensive Driving. The specifics of this talent require the optional vehicle rules, on page 220. If your game does not use these rules, this talent adds {@dice setback} per rank to combat checks targeting your character's vehicle or your character while piloting it.

talent.name: Defensive Stance
description: Once per round, your character may suffer a number of strain no greater than their ranks in Defensive Stance to use this talent. Then, until the end of your character's next turn, upgrade the difficulty of all melee combat checks targeting your character a number of times equal to the strain suffered.

talent.name: Defensive Sysops
description: When attempting to defend a computer system against intrusion (or when someone attempts to hack a computer owned or programmed by your character) your character adds {@dice setback|2} to their opponent's checks. If your character has access to the computer system when the intrusion takes place, they are automatically aware of the intrusion.

talent.name: Defensive Sysops (Improved)
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the {@talent Defensive Sysops} talent to benefit from this talent}. Before adding {@dice setback|2} from {@talent Defensive Sysops} to a check, use this talent to add {@symbols fh} to the results of the check instead.

talent.name: Desperate Recovery
description: Before your character heals strain at the end of an encounter, if their strain is more than half of their strain threshold, they heal two additional strain.

talent.name: Dire Animal Companion
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the {@talent Animal Companion||crb} talent to benefit from this talent}. If your character has at least one rank in the {@skill Primal||crb} skill, the animal companion they have bonded with through the {@talent Animal Companion||crb} talent increases its Brawn by one, to a maximum of 5, and its wound threshold by four. If it is a nemesis, it increases its strain threshold by four. If it is a minion or rival, it becomes a nemesis and gains a strain threshold of 6. If it is silhouette 0, it becomes silhouette 1. Your character also chooses to increase either its Agility or its Willpower by one, to a maximum of 5, and its {@skill Brawl||crb}, {@skill Discipline||crb}, {@skill Perception||crb}, or {@skill Survival||crb} by one, to a maximum of 5.

talent.name: Dirty Tricks
description: After your character inflicts a Critical Injury on an adversary, they may use this talent to upgrade the difficulty of that adversary's next check.

talent.name: Dissonance
description: While wielding a musical instrument, your character may use this talent to make an {@difficulty average|Charm or Verse}. For each {@symbols s} the check generates, one enemy of the player's choosing within medium range suffers 1 wound. For each {@symbols a}, one enemy affected by Dissonance suffers 1 additional wound.

talent.name: Distinctive Style
description: When making a {@skill Computers} check to hack a system or break into a secured network, before rolling, your character may use this talent to add {@symbols ss}{@symbols hh} to the results. If you are using the optional hacking rules on page 232 and your check generates {@symbols hh}, your GM should spend it on the I Know You! option in {@table III.2-22: Spending Symbols in Hacking Encounters} on page 234 of the Genesys Core Rulebook.

talent.name: Dodge
description: When your character is targeted by a combat check (ranged or melee), they may suffer a number of strain no greater than their ranks in Dodge to use this talent. Then, upgrade the difficulty of the combat check targeting your character a number of times equal to the strain suffered.

talent.name: Dominion of the Dimora
description: Your character cannot take this talent if they have taken the {@talent Favor of the Fae} talent. When casting an {@spell Attack||crb} spell, your character may add the Impact effect without increasing the difficulty. Your character can never add the Manipulative effect.

talent.name: Druid
description: When your character casts a {@spell Conjure||crb} spell using the {@skill Primal||crb} skill, they always add the Summon Ally effect without increasing the difficulty, and they must always summon a living animal (such as those starting on page 86). The animal remains for the duration of the encounter even if your character does not use a concentrate maneuver to maintain the spell. At your GM's discretion, the animal may have already been nearby rather than summoned from thin air. Likewise, at the end of the encounter, the animal may revert back to its natural behavior instead of vanishing.

talent.name: Dual Strike
description: When resolving a combined check to attack with two weapons in a melee combat, your character may suffer 2 strain to use this talent to hit with the secondary weapon (instead of spending {@symbols aa}).

talent.name: Dual Wielder
description: Once per round, your character may use this talent to decrease the difficulty of the next combined combat check (see Two-Weapon Combat, on page 108) they make during the same turn by one.

talent.name: Duelist
description: Your character adds {@dice boost} to their melee combat checks while engaged with a single opponent. Your character adds {@dice setback} to their melee combat checks while engaged with three or more opponents.

talent.name: Dungeoneer
description: After your character makes a {@skill Perception||crb}, {@skill Vigilance||crb}, or {@skill Knowledge (Adventuring)} check to notice, identify, or avoid a threat in a cavern, subterranean ruin, or similar location, your character cancels a number of uncanceled {@symbols h} no greater than your character's ranks in Dungeoneer.

talent.name: Durable
description: Your character reduces any {@table I.6-10: Critical Injury Result|Critical Injury} result they suffer by 10 per rank of Durable, to a minimum of 01.

talent.name: Eagle Eyes
description: Once per encounter before making a ranged combat check, you may use this talent to increase your weapon's range by one range band (to a maximum of extreme range). This lasts for the duration of the combat check.

talent.name: Easy Prey
description: Your character may suffer 3 strain to use this talent. Until the start of your character's next turn, your character and allies within short range add {@dice boost|2} to combat checks against {@rule immobilized||crb} targets.

talent.name: Elementalist
description: When your character purchases this talent, choose one of the following attack spell effects (and the element associated with it): Fire (fire), Ice (water), Impact (earth), or Lightning (air). Whenever your character casts an {@spell Attack||crb} spell, they always add the chosen effect to the spell without increasing the difficulty. However, they may never add any of the other three effects to a spell they cast.

talent.name: Elementalist (Improved)
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the Elementalist talent to benefit from this talent}. When your character purchases this talent, they gain one of the following abilities based on the element they selected when they purchased {@talent Elementalist}: they cannot be knocked prone or {@rule staggered||crb} (earth), they cannot be {@rule immobilized||crb} and can breathe underwater (water), they cannot be {@rule disoriented||crb} and can fly using the hovering guidelines in the {@sidebar Flying||crb} sidebar on page 100 of the {@title Genesys} Core Rulebook (air), or they are immune to fire - including ignoring damage from attacks with the {@quality Burn||crb} item quality and from other fire-based attacks (fire).

talent.name: Elementalist (Supreme)
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the {@talent Elementalist (Improved)|Improved Elementalist} talent to benefit from this talent}. When your character casts an {@spell augment||crb}, {@spell barrier||crb}, or {@spell transform} spell, they may use this talent to choose to have the targets of the spell gain the ability your character gained when they purchased {@talent Elementalist (Improved)|Improved Elementalist} for the spell's duration.

talent.name: Encouraging Song
description: While equipped with a musical instrument, your character may use this talent to make an {@difficulty average|charm or verse}. For each {@symbols s} the check generates, one ally within medium range adds {@dice boost} to their next skill check. For each {@symbols a}, one ally benefiting from Encouraging Song heals 1 strain.

talent.name: Enduring
description: Each rank of Enduring increases your character's soak value by one.

talent.name: Ensorcelled
description: If your character has at least one rank in a magic skill, once per encounter, they may use this talent to add {@symbols a} to the result their next social skill check.

Additionally, this has a passive narrative effect; your character's appearance is subtly enhanced by their magic. Others do not note it as supernatural, but may be slightly put off. What form this enhancement takes is up to you, with your GM's approval, but it should be based on the magic skill your character possesses (as well as their backstory). A character with the {@skill Divine||crb} skill may always be flushed with good health, or their eyes may flash red momentarily. A character with the {@skill Primal||crb} skill may be surrounded by the scent of fresh pine, or their voice may have an intimidating growl. A character with the {@skill Arcana||crb} skill may have their hair tousled by undetectable winds, or when they wear a hat or hood, their face might be obscured by strangely deep shadows.

talent.name: Ensorcelled (Improved)
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the {@talent Ensorcelled} talent to benefit from this talent}. If your character has at least two ranks in a magic skill, when using the {@talent Ensorcelled} talent, they may add {@symbols sa} to their next social skill check (instead of {@symbols a}).

After purchasing this talent, your character's appearance is now noticeably changed by their magic. What form this enhancement takes is up to you, with your GM's approval, but it should be based on the magic skill your character possesses as well as the enhancement they originally possessed with the {@talent Ensorcelled} talent.

talent.name: Ensorcelled (Supreme)
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the {@talent Ensorcelled (Improved)|Improved Ensorcelled} talent to benefit from this talent}. If your character has at least three ranks in a magic skill, once per session they may use this talent to force all enemies within medium range to make a {@difficulty Hard|Discipline} as an out-of-turn incidental. If they fail, they must spend all available maneuvers moving away from your character, and they suffer 5 strain, plus 1 additional strain per {@symbols h} (if your group is using the optional Fear rules on page 243 of the Core Rulebook, this can be treated as a fear check).

What form this reveal takes is up to you, with your GM's approval, but is should be based on your character's magic skill and the enhancement they possess from the {@talent Ensorcelled (Improved)|Improved Ensorcelled} talent. Some possibilities include growing golden wings of light, manifesting demonic horns and glowing red eyes, rising into the air on a tornado, becoming a figure of pure shadow, or transforming into a massive treelike humanoid.

talent.name: Exploit
description: When your character makes a combat check with a Ranged or Melee (Light) weapon, they may suffer 2 strain to use this talent to add the {@quality Ensnare||crb} quality to the attack. The rating of the {@quality Ensnare||crb} quality is equal to your character's ranks in Exploit.

talent.name: Explosive Casting
description: When your character casts an {@spell attack||crb} spell, they treat the spell's {@quality Blast||crb} quality as having a rating equal to twice your character's ranks in {@skill Knowledge||crb} (instead of their ranks in {@skill Knowledge||crb}). When your character casts an {@spell Attack||crb} spell with the {@quality Blast||crb} effect, you may spend one Story Point to use this talent to trigger the spell's {@quality Blast||crb} quality, instead of spending {@symbols a} (even if the attack misses).

talent.name: Face of the Wild
description: When your character casts a {@spell transform} spell on themself using the {@skill Primal||crb} skill, you may spend a Story Point to have them use this talent to maintain the effects of the spell until the end of the encounter, without performing concentrate maneuvers.

talent.name: Fan the Hammer
description: Once per encounter before making a combat check with a pistol (your GM has the final say on whether a weapon is a pistol or not), your character may use this talent to add the {@quality Auto-fire} quality to the pistol when resolving the check. If your character does, the weapon runs out of ammo exactly as with an Out of Ammo result (see {@table I.6-3: Spending Threat and Despair in Combat} on page 104).

talent.name: Favor of the Fae
description: Your character cannot take this talent if they have taken the {@talent Dominion of the Dimora} talent. When casting an {@spell Attack||crb} spell, your character may add the Manipulative effect without increasing the difficulty. Your character can never add the Impact effect.

talent.name: Field Commander
description: Your character may use this talent to make an {@difficulty average|leadership}. If successful, a number of allies equal to your character's Presence may immediately suffer 1 strain to perform one maneuver (out of turn). If there are any questions as to which allies take their maneuvers first, your character is the final arbiter.

talent.name: Field Commander (Improved)
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the {@talent Field Commander} talent to benefit from this talent}. When your character uses the {@talent Field Commander} talent, your character affects a number of allies equal to twice the character's Presence. In addition, you may spend {@symbols t} to allow one ally to suffer 1 strain to perform an action, instead of a maneuver.

talent.name: Finesse
description: When making a {@skill Brawl||crb} or {@skill Melee (Light)||crb} check, your character may use Agility instead of Brawn.

talent.name: Flames of Kellos
description: Your character cannot take this talent if they have taken the {@talent Chill of Nordros} talent. When casting an {@spell Attack||crb} spell, your character may add the Fire effect without increasing the difficulty. Your character can never add the Ice effect.

talent.name: Flash of Insight
description: When your character generates {@symbols t} on a knowledge skill check, roll {@dice boost|2} and add the results to the check, in addition to spending the {@symbols t} as usual.

talent.name: Flicker Step
description: When your character casts a spell using the {@skill Arcana||crb} skill, they may use this talent to spend {@symbols aaa or t} to instantly vanish and reappear at any location within long range.

talent.name: Forager
description: Your character removes up to {@dice setback|2} from any skill checks they make to find food, water, or shelter. Checks to forage or search the area that your character makes take half the time they would normally.

talent.name: Forgot to Count?
description: When an opponent makes a ranged combat check, you can spend {@symbols hh} from that check to use this talent to cause their weapon to run out of ammo (see {@table I.6-3: Spending Threat and Despair in Combat} on page 104), as long as the weapon can normally run out of ammunition.

talent.name: Full Throttle
description: While driving or flying, your character may use this talent to make a {@difficulty hard|Piloting or Driving}. If successful, the top speed of the vehicle increases by one (to a maximum of 5) for a number of rounds equal to your character's Cunning. The specifics of this talent require the optional vehicle rules, on page 220. If your game does not use these rules, this talent simply makes the vehicle go much faster than normal, with the specifics up to your GM.

talent.name: Grapple
description: Your character may suffer 2 strain to use this talent. Until the start of your character's next turn, enemies must spend two maneuvers to disengage from your character.

talent.name: Grenadier
description: When your character makes a ranged combat check with a weapon that has the {@quality Blast} item quality, you may spend one Story Point to use this talent to trigger the weapon's {@quality Blast} quality, instead of spending {@symbols a} (even if the attack misses). In addition, your character treats grenades as having a range of medium.

talent.name: Grit
description: Each rank of Grit increases your character's strain threshold by one.

talent.name: Hamstring Shot
description: Once per round, your character may use this talent to perform a ranged combat check against one non-vehicle target within range of the weapon used. If the check is successful, halve the damage inflicted by the attack (before reducing damage by the target's soak). The target is {@rule immobilized} until the end of its next turn.

talent.name: Heightened Awareness
description: Allies within short range of your character add {@dice boost} to their {@skill Perception} and {@skill Vigilance} checks. Allies engaged with your character add {@dice boost|2} instead.

talent.name: Heroic Recovery
description: When your character acquires this talent, choose one characteristic. Once per encounter, you may spend one Story Point to use this talent to have your character heal strain equal to the rating of the chosen characteristic.

talent.name: Heroic Will
description: When you purchase this talent for your character, choose two characteristics. You may spend a Story Point to use this talent to have your character ignore the effects of all {@table I.6-10: Critical Injury Result|Critical Injuries} on any skill checks using those two characteristics until the end of the current encounter. (Your character still suffers the {@table I.6-10: Critical Injury Result|Critical Injuries}; they just ignore the effects. See page 114.)

talent.name: How Convenient!
description: Once per session, your character may use this talent to make a {@difficulty hard|Mechanics}. If successful, one device involved in the current encounter (subject to your GM's approval) spontaneously fails. This can be because of your character's actions, or it can simply be incredibly convenient timing!

talent.name: Hunter
description: {@skill Knowledge (Geography)}, {@skill Ranged||crb}, and {@skill Survival||crb} are now career skills for your character.

talent.name: Impaling Strike
description: When your character inflicts a Critical Injury with a melee weapon, until the end of the target's next turn they may use this talent to {@rule immobilized|immobilize|crb} the target (in addition to the other effects of the Critical Injury).

talent.name: Indomitable
description: Once per encounter, when your character would be incapacitated due to exceeding their wound or strain threshold, you may spend a Story Point to use this talent. Then, your character is not incapacitated until the end of their next turn. If your character reduces their strain or wounds to below their threshold before the end of their next turn, they are not incapacitated.

talent.name: Innate Focus
description: While not using a magic implement, your character increases the base damage of all {@spell Attack||crb} spells they cast by two. In addition, when casting a spell while not using a magic implement, your character may use this talent to decrease the difficulty of the check by one. If they do so, they increase the strain suffered for casting the spell by one.

talent.name: Inspiring Rhetoric
description: Your character may use this talent to make an {@difficulty average|Leadership}. For each {@symbols s} the check generates, one ally within short range heals one strain. For each {@symbols a}, one ally benefiting from Inspiring Rhetoric heals one additional strain.

talent.name: Inspiring Rhetoric (Improved)
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the {@talent Inspiring Rhetoric} talent to benefit from this talent}. Allies affected by your character's {@talent Inspiring Rhetoric} add {@dice boost} to all skill checks they make for a number of rounds equal to your character's ranks in Leadership.

talent.name: Inspiring Rhetoric (Supreme)
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the {@talent Inspiring Rhetoric} talent to benefit from this talent}. Your character may choose to suffer 1 strain to use the {@talent Inspiring Rhetoric} talent as a maneuver, instead of as an action.

talent.name: Inventor
description: When your character makes a check to construct new items or modify existing ones, use this talent to add a number of {@dice boost} to the check equal to ranks of Inventor. In addition, your character may attempt to reconstruct devices that they have heard described but have not seen and do not have any kinds of plans or schematics for.

talent.name: Jump Up
description: Once per round during your character's turn, your character may use this talent to stand from a prone or seated position as an incidental.

talent.name: Justice of the Citadel
description: Once per round on your character's turn, your character may suffer 3 strain to use this talent to add damage equal to their ranks in {@skill Discipline||crb} to one hit of a successful melee attack.

talent.name: Knack for It
description: When you purchase this talent for your character, select one skill. Your character removes {@dice setback|2} from any checks they make using this skill. Each additional time you purchase this talent for your character, select two additional skills. Your character also removes {@dice setback|2} from any checks they make using these skills. You cannot select combat or magic skills when choosing skills for this talent.

talent.name: Know Somebody
description: Once per session, when attempting to purchase a legally available item, your character may use this talent to reduce its rarity by one per rank of Know Somebody.

talent.name: Let's Ride
description: Once per round during your character's turn, your character can use this talent to mount or dismount from a vehicle or animal, or move from one position in a vehicle to another (such as from the cockpit to a gun turret) as an incidental. In addition, if your character suffers a short-range fall (see {@table I.6-9: Falling Damage} on page 112) from a vehicle or animal, they suffer no damage and land on their feet.

talent.name: Let's Talk This Over
description: Once per game session, when a combat encounter against one or more sentient beings is about to begin, the character make a {@difficulty daunting|Charm}. If successful, the combat encounter instead becomes a social encounter, with the PCs attempting to convince their opposition to back down, come around to their viewpoint, or accept a compromise. The GM is the final arbiter of how the situation resolves without violence (or how the combat encounter continues if the character's check is unsuccessful).

talent.name: Lucky Strike
description: When your character purchases this talent, choose one characteristic. After your character makes a successful combat check, you may spend one Story Point to use this talent to add damage equal to your character's ranks in that characteristic to one hit of the combat check.

talent.name: Mad Inventor
description: Once per session, your character may use this talent to make a {@skill Mechanics} check to attempt to cobble together the functional equivalent of any item using spare parts or salvage. The difficulty of the check is based on the item's rarity; see {@table I.4-1: Mad Inventor Item Rarity} in the {@title Genesys Core Rulebook}. Your GM will modify the check based on the circumstances and might decide that some items simply can't be created with what's available (if you are being held in a prison cell, for instance). Your GM may spend {@symbols d} on the check to indicate the item ends up being dangerous to the user and anyone around them in some way. For instance, a pistol might explode instead of running out of ammo, or a breathing mask might make the user light-headed.

talent.name: Master
description: When you purchase this talent for your character, choose one skill. Once per round, your character may suffer 2 strain to use this talent to reduce the difficulty of the next check they make using that skill by two, to a minimum of {@difficulty easy}.

talent.name: Master of Illusion
description: After your character makes a successful {@spell Mask} spell to create an illusion, you may spend a Story Point to have your character use this talent to make the illusion last until the end of the encounter, without performing concentrate maneuvers, and not need to remain within the spell's range after being cast. You may spend two Story Points to make the illusion last until the end of the session instead.

talent.name: Masterful Casting
description: When your character casts a spell, they may use this talent to spend {@symbols t} to trigger up to three different qualities or spell effects instead of one. These qualities or spell effects must be ones that can be triggered by spending {@symbols a or t}.

talent.name: Natural
description: When your character purchases this talent, choose two skills. Once per session, your character may use this talent to reroll one skill check that uses one of those two skills.

talent.name: Natural Communion
description: When your character uses the Conjure magic action, the spell gains the Summon Ally effect without increasing the difficulty. All creatures your character summons must be naturally occurring animals native to the area

talent.name: One with Nature
description: When in the wilderness, your character may make a {@difficulty simple|Survival}, instead of {@skill Discipline} or {@skill Cool}, to recover strain at the end of an encounter (see page 117).

talent.name: Overcharge
description: Once per encounter, your character may use this talent to make a {@difficulty hard|Mechanics} and choose one of their cybernetic implants that grants them one of the following: +1 to a characteristic rating, +1 rank to a skill, +1 rank of a ranked talent. If your character succeeds, until the end of the encounter, the chosen cybernetic instead provides +2 to the affected characteristic rating (to a maximum of 7), skill (to a maximum of 5), or ranked talent. Your GM may spend {@symbols d} or {@symbols hhh} from the check to have the overcharged cybernetic short out at the end of the encounter; it provides no benefit until your character spends several hours making an {@difficulty average|Mechanics}.

talent.name: Overcharge (Improved)
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the {@talent Overcharge} talent to benefit from this talent}. When using the {@talent Overcharge} talent, your character may spend {@symbols aa} or {@symbols t} from the {@skill Mechanics} check to immediately take one additional action. This talent can only be used once per check.

talent.name: Painful Blow
description: When your character makes a combat check, you may voluntarily increase the difficulty by one to use this talent. If the target suffers one or more wounds from the combat check, the target suffers 2 strain each time they perform a maneuver until the end of the encounter.

talent.name: Painkiller Specialization
description: When your character uses {@gear painkiller|painkillers} (or their equivalent, depending on the setting), the target heals one additional wound per rank of Painkiller Specialization. The sixth painkiller and beyond each day still has no effect.

talent.name: Parry
description: When your character suffers a hit from a melee combat check, after damage is calculated but before soak is applied (so immediately after Step 3 of Perform a Combat check, page 102), your character may suffer 3 strain to use this talent to reduce the damage of the hit by two plus their ranks in Parry. This talent can only be used once per hit, and your character needs to be wielding a Melee weapon.

talent.name: Parry (Improved)
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the {@talent Parry} talent to benefit from this talent}. When your character suffers a hit from a melee combat check and uses {@talent Parry} to reduce the damage from that hit, after the attack is resolved, you may spend {@symbols d} or {@symbols hhh} from the attacker's check to use this talent. Then, your character automatically hits the attacker once with a Brawl or Melee weapon your character is wielding. The hit deals the weapon's base damage, plus any damage from applicable talents or abilities. Your character can't use this talent if the original attack incapacitates them.

talent.name: Polymorph
description: If your character has at least one rank in the {@skill Arcana||crb} or {@skill Divine||crb} skill, they can cast the {@spell transform} spell. However, they can use the spell to only transform into magical or supernatural creatures (such as dragons, angels, demons, or elementals).

talent.name: Potent Concoctions
description: When your character makes an {@skill Alchemy||crb} check that generates {@symbols t}, roll an additional {@dice proficiency} and add its results to the pool, in addition to spending the {@symbols t} normally. When your character makes an {@skill Alchemy||crb} check that generates {@symbols d}, roll an additional {@dice challenge} and add its results to the pool, in addition to spending the {@symbols d} normally. Each of these effects can occur only once per check.

talent.name: Precise Archery
description: When making a {@skill Ranged||crb} combat check targeting a character engaged with one of your character's allies, downgrade the difficulty of the check once (thus negating the penalty for shooting at engaged targets).

talent.name: Precision
description: When making a {@skill Brawl||crb} or {@skill Ranged||crb} check, your character may use Cunning instead of Brawn and Agility.

talent.name: Pressure Point
description: When your character makes an unarmed {@skill Brawl||crb} check targeting a living opponent, they may use this talent to deal strain damage instead of wound damage, and inflict additional strain damage equal to their ranks in {@skill Medicine||crb}.

talent.name: Proper Upbringing
description: When your character makes a social skill check in polite company (as determined by your GM), they may suffer a number of strain to use this talent to add an equal number of {@symbols a} to the check. The number may not exceed your character's ranks in Proper Upbringing.

talent.name: Quick Draw
description: Once per round on your character's turn, they may use this talent to draw or holster an easily accessible weapon or item as an incidental. Quick Draw also reduces a weapon's {@quality Prepare} rating by one, to a minimum of one.

talent.name: Quick Strike
description: Your character adds {@dice boost} for each rank of Quick Strike to any combat checks they make against any targets that have not yet taken their turn in the current encounter.

talent.name: Rapid Archery
description: While your character is armed with a bow (or similar weapon, at your GM's discretion) they may suffer 2 strain to use this talent. During the next ranged combat check your character makes this turn, the bow gains the {@quality Linked} quality with a value equal to their ranks in the Ranged skill.

talent.name: Rapid Reaction
description: Your character may suffer a number of strain to use this talent to add an equal number of {@symbols s} to a {@skill Vigilance} or {@skill Cool} check they make to {@rule determine Initiative} order. The number may not exceed your character's ranks in Rapid Reaction.

talent.name: Reckless Charge
description: After using a maneuver to move engage an adversary, your character may suffer 2 strain to use this talent. They then add {@symbols ss}{@symbols hh} to the results of the next {@skill Brawl||crb}, {@skill Melee (Light)||crb}, or {@skill Melee (Heavy)||crb} combat check they make this turn.

talent.name: Retribution
description: Once per round when an adversary attacks an ally within medium range, your character may spend one Story Point to use this talent to automatically hit that enemy once with a weapon your character is wielding, if the enemy is within the weapon's range. The hit deals the weapon's base damage, plus any damage from applicable talents or abilities.

talent.name: Ruinous Repartee
description: Once per encounter, your character may use this talent to make an opposed {@skill Charm} or {@skill Coercion} versus {@skill Discipline} check targeting one character within medium range (or within earshot). If successful, the target suffers strain equal to twice your character's Presence, plus one additional strain per {@symbols s}. Your character heals strain equal to the strain inflicted. If incapacitated due to this talent, the target could flee the scene in shame, collapse in a dejected heap, or throw themself at your character in fury, depending on your GM and the nature of your character's witty barbs.

talent.name: Runic Lore
description: {@skill Knowledge (Lore)} and {@skill Runes} are now career skills for your character.

talent.name: Scathing Tirade
description: Your character may use this talent to make an {@difficulty average|Coercion}. For each {@symbols s} the check generates, one enemy within short range suffers 1 strain. For each {@symbols a}, one enemy affected by Scathing Tirade suffers 1 additional strain.

talent.name: Scathing Tirade (Improved)
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the {@talent Scathing Tirade} talent to benefit from this talent}. Enemies affected by your character's {@talent Scathing Tirade} add {@dice setback} to all skill checks they make for a number of rounds equal to your character's ranks in {@skill Coercion}.

talent.name: Scathing Tirade (Supreme)
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the {@talent Scathing Tirade} talent to benefit from this talent}. Your character may choose to suffer 1 strain to use the {@talent Scathing Tirade} talent as a maneuver, instead of as an action.

talent.name: Second Wind
description: Once per encounter, your character may use this talent to heal an amount of strain equal to their ranks in Second Wind.

talent.name: Shapeshifter
description: When your character is incapacitated due to having exceeded their strain threshold while in their normal form, they undergo the following change as an out-of-turn incidental: they heal all strain, increase their Brawn and Agility by one to a maximum of 5 and reduce their Intellect and Willpower by one to a minimum of 1. They deal +1 damage when making unarmed attacks and their unarmed attacks have a Critical rating of 3, but they cannot use magic skills or make ranged attacks. Your GM should ensure that NPCs react appropriately to this (at the very least, upgrading the difficulty of social skill checks twice). Your character reverts to their normal form after eight hours or if they become incapacitated (for instance, by exceeding their wound or strain threshold).

talent.name: Shapeshifter (Improved)
description: Once per session, your character may make a {@difficulty hard|Discipline} as an out-of-turn incidental either to trigger {@talent Shapeshifter} or to avoid triggering it when they exceed their strain threshold.

talent.name: Shield Slam
description: When your character uses a shield to attack a minion or rival, you may spend {@symbols aaaa} or {@symbols t} to stagger the target until the end of the target's next turn.

talent.name: Shockwave
description: Your character treats {@skill Melee (Heavy)||crb} weapons as possessing the {@quality Blast||crb} item quality with a rating equal to your character's ranks in {@skill Melee (Heavy)||crb}. Your character does not suffer damage from their weapon's {@quality Blast||crb} quality (but allies do!).

talent.name: Side Step
description: Once per round, your character may suffer a number of strain no greater than their ranks in Side Step to use this talent. Until the end of your character's next turn, upgrade the difficulty of all ranged combat checks targeting your character a number of times equal to the strain suffered.

talent.name: Signature Spell
description: When your character gains this talent, decide on a signature spell for them, consisting of a particular magic action and a specific set of one or more effects. When your character casts their signature spell (consisting of the exact combination of action and effects previously chosen), reduce the difficulty of the check by one.

talent.name: Signature Spell (Improved)
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the {@talent Signature Spell} talent to benefit from this talent}. When your character casts their signature spell, reduce the difficulty of the check by two instead of one.

talent.name: Strength of Faith
description: Once per session, your character may use this talent to add {@symbols s} equal to their ranks in {@skill Discipline||crb} and {@symbols a} equal to their ranks in Willpower to the results of the next {@skill Divine||crb} skill check they make during this turn.

talent.name: Surgeon
description: When your character makes a {@skill Medicine} check to heal wounds, the target heals one additional wound per rank of Surgeon.

talent.name: Swift
description: Your character does not suffer the penalties for moving through {@sidebar Hazards and Difficult Terrain|difficult terrain} (they move through {@sidebar Hazards and Difficult Terrain|difficult terrain} at normal speed without spending additional maneuvers).

talent.name: Tavern Brawler
description: Your character adds {@symbols a} to {@skill Brawl||crb} checks and combat checks using improvised weapons.

talent.name: Teleportation
description: If your character has at least one rank in {@skill Arcana||crb}, once per session, your character may use this talent to make a {@difficulty Daunting|Arcana}. If they succeed, they instantly vanish and reappear in any other location in the world they already know about.

Your character may bring up to five allies with them when they teleport, but they must add {@dice setback} to the check for each ally. They may also teleport to different worlds or planes of existence; however, they must upgrade the difficulty of the check once (or more, at your GM's discretion) if they do so. Whenever your character uses this talent, your GM may spend {@symbols h} to have the teleportation miss the location by a range band per {@symbols h} spent, or may spend {@symbols hhhh or d} to have the teleportation go catastrophically wrong (by having a character materialize in a wall, another person, or midair, for instance, with the awful consequences to be determined by your GM).

talent.name: Teleportation (Improved)
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the {@talent Teleportation} talent to benefit from this talent}. Your character may use this talent to make a {@difficulty Hard|Arcana} to create a permanent beacon, glyph, or teleportation circle in a location (how it appears is up to you and your GM, but it should be large and noticeable).

When your character uses the {@talent Teleportation} talent, if they choose to teleport to the location of their beacon, glyph, or teleportation circle, the difficulty of the check is {@difficulty Average} and they do not add {@dice setback} for teleporting additional allies. They also do not upgrade the difficulty of the check to teleport to a different world or plane of existence.

Your character can have two glyphs, beacons, or circles established at any one time per rank of Improved Teleportation. If they create any over this limit, one of the originals of your character's choice is destroyed.

talent.name: Templar
description: {@skill Divine||crb} is now a career skill for your character. They can only cast one spell using this skill per encounter.

talent.name: Templar (Improved)
description: {@i Your character must have purchased the {@talent Templar} talent to benefit from this talent}. When your character casts the single {@skill Divine||crb} spell per encounter granted by the {@talent Templar} talent, they do not add {@dice setback} for wearing heavy armor (armor with +2 soak or higher), using a shield, or not having at least one hand free (see {@table III.2-3: Penalties When Casting Spells||crb}, on page 210 of the Genesys Core Rulebook).

talent.name: Threaten
description: After an adversary within short range of your character resolves a combat check that deals damage to one of your character's allies, your character may suffer 3 strain to use this talent to inflict a number of strain on the adversary equal to your character's ranks in {@skill Coercion||crb}. The range of this talent increases by one band per rank of Threaten beyond the first.

talent.name: Toughened
description: Each rank of Toughened increases your character's wound threshold by two.

talent.name: Tumble
description: Once per round on your character's turn, they may suffer 2 strain to disengage from all engaged adversaries.

talent.name: Unrelenting
description: Once per round after resolving a successful {@skill Brawl||crb}, {@skill Melee (Light)||crb}, or {@skill Melee (Heavy)||crb} combat check, your character may suffer 4 strain to use this talent to make an additional melee attack as an incidental against the same target. Increase the difficulty of the combat check by one if this attack uses a second weapon, or by two if the attack uses the same weapon.

talent.name: Unremarkable
description: Other characters add {@symbols f} to any checks made to find or identify your character in a crowd.

talent.name: Venom Soaked Blade
description: When making a {@skill Melee (Light)||crb} combat check using a poisoned weapon, your character treats it as possessing the {@quality Burn|Burn 2|crb} item quality.

talent.name: Well-Travelled
description: {@skill Knowledge (Geography)}, {@skill Negotiation||crb}, and {@skill Vigilance||crb} are now career skills for your character.

talent.name: Whirlwind
description: Your character may suffer 4 strain to use this talent to make a {@skill Brawl||crb}, {@skill Melee (Light)||crb}, or {@skill Melee (Heavy)||crb} attack against the engaged adversary who is hardest to hit (as determined by the GM), increasing the difficulty by one. If the combat check succeeds, each adversary engaged with the character suffers one hit from the attack, that deals base damage plus damage equal to the total {@symbols s} scored on the check.

talent.name: Wraithbane
description: Your character counts the Critical rating of their weapon as one lower to a minimum of 1 when making an attack targeting an undead adversary.

talent.name: Zealous Fire
description: Each time your Game Master spends a Story Point, your character heals 2 strain.
